findSimConnectPortIPv4

public static int findSimConnectPortIPv4()
Attempts to retrieve the simconnect TCP port number by looking up registry values. Negative values indicates a failure while guessing the registry port (ie no registry available, process execute failure, no key, etc). A zero value is thus a success, and it indicates that an ipv4 is not open because either FSX is not running, or no local ipv4 connections has been configured in simconnect.xml

Returns:
-1 if registry key is not found or cannot be read; >= 0 else.
Since:
0.6
See Also:
findSimConnectPortIPv6()

findSimConnectPortIPv6

public static int findSimConnectPortIPv6()
Attempts to retrieve the simconnect TCP port number by looking up registry values. Negative values indicates a failure while guessing the registry port (ie no registry available, process execute failure, no key, etc). A zero value is thus a success, and it indicates that an ipv6 is not open because either FSX is not running, or no local ipv6 connections has been configured in simconnect.xml.

Warning: currently ipv6 support is broken on Windows 2003, NT and XP.

Returns:
-1 if registry key is not found or cannot be read; >= 0 else.
Since:
0.6
See Also:
findSimConnectPortIPv4()

findSimConnectPort

public static int findSimConnectPort()
Attempts to retrieve the simconnect TCP port number by looking up registry values. Negative values indicates a failure while guessing the registry port (ie no registry available, process execute failure, no key, etc). A zero value is thus a success, and it indicates that no local connections has been configured in simconnect.xml or FSX is not running.
This method just try to lookup the IPv4 port first, then fallback with the ipV6 port if not found

Returns:
-1 if registry key is not found or cannot be read; >= 0 else.
Since:
0.6
See Also:
findSimConnectPortIPv4(), findSimConnectPortIPv6()
